body: I will create a separate PR to address C++ change. So, we can merge this one for now.
Created a new PR #538 so, closing this one.
@rdhabalia I'll get to this one soon

@jai1 One C++ test failure: 

```
/home/travis/build/apache/incubator-pulsar/pulsar-client-cpp/tests/BatchMessageTest.cc:309: Failure
Value of: numOfMessages
  Actual: 100000
Expected: t
Which is: 63060
[  FAILED  ] BatchMessageTest.testSmallReceiverQueueSize (23243 ms)
```
as it's already created under `pulsar-client-cpp` , should we add as a part of sub-module at main build.??
I was not entirely sure about that, because it would require to have wireshark-dev installed to compile just the c++ client library.

> By using gtest-parallel I see that we can complete the tests in 55 seconds, which 7 times faster.

As tests run in parallel so, should we make sure that topic name in all tests are different else tests may fail intermittently as they share same broker instance?
@merlimat Building wireshark plugin should be lightweight, right? In that case, isn't better to have it built, so we can keep it up todate as well?

I noticed that explanation for `authorizationAllowWildcardsMatching` was old.
https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/blob/1994f4f0b3e3ede13223838ade4b7c989f3e13d3/conf/websocket.conf#L62

I will fix it in this PR.

Sorry, will you please take a look at the last commit ?

@saandrews @rdhabalia This should fix the build in master
ping @saandrews @jai1 @rdhabalia
With this change, are we going to generate only static library? Having the ability to generate both might be useful.

>  With this change, are we going to generate only static library? Having the ability to generate both might be useful.

The build always generates both `libpulsar.so` and `libpulsar.a` as before. The only difference is that `libpulsar.so` is statically linking the dependencies to have a self-contained library.

I can make the static linking configurable at the CMake level. Unfortunately it's not easy to have both builds since it needs to search for different dependencies.

>I can make the static linking configurable at the CMake level. Unfortunately it's not easy to have both builds since it needs to search for different dependencies.

If it easy to get these using different targets, let us try to get that as an option. Else, we can address it later.

On Thu, Jul 6, 2017 at 10:05 AM, Andrews <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> If it easy to get these using different targets, let us try to get that as
> an option. Else, we can address it later.
>
No, it won't work, because CMake either looks (and links with) for
libbboost_thread.so or for libboost.a. That's independent from the targets.


--
Matteo Merli
<matteo.merli@gmail.com>

We can only have a flag that decides whether to either link statically or
dynamically with the dependencies.

--
Matteo Merli
<matteo.merli@gmail.com>

```
main: /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:653: typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type boost::shared_ptr<T>::operator->() const [with T = boost::asio::basic_deadline_timer<boost::posix_time::ptime>; typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type = boost::asio::basic_deadline_timer<boost::posix_time::ptime>*]: Assertion `px != 0' failed.
[63/73] BasicEndToEndTest.testResendViaSendCallback returned/aborted with exit code -6 (4402 ms)
```
For review purposes, the generated website is temporarily available at https://streamlio.github.io/incubator-pulsar/

> Can't the latency measurement be done in the ZK client wrapper?

Latency is measured against [ZK-Client](https://github.com/rdhabalia/pulsar/blob/ce73e74e2702b32cbd9a553949017033b901e1d2/pulsar-broker/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/broker/zookeeper/aspectj/ClientCnxnAspect.java#L64) `org.apache.zookeeper.ClientCnxn` only. So, you mean `ClientCnxnAspect` should not be part of pulsar-broker and part of other module?

> Though I don't completely understand if the AOT part is needed if we are going to wrap the ZooKeeper client class.

Not, completely understand your comment. But in this PR we are loading [AOT-agent at runtime](https://github.com/rdhabalia/pulsar/blob/ce73e74e2702b32cbd9a553949017033b901e1d2/pulsar-broker/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/PulsarStandaloneStarter.java?utf8=%E2%9C%93#L160) because of that we don't have to define agent in jvm-args and we can test aspect with unit-test. 
In previous ZK-server-aspect PR, we don't have any unit-test case because we can't weave aspectj-  advice in unit-test so, hard to test as well. So, do you think we should load aspectj-agent at runtime rather passing as jvm-args in zk-server AOT?

> Latency is measured against ZK-Client org.apache.zookeeper.ClientCnxn only. So, you mean ClientCnxnAspect should not be part of pulsar-broker and part of other module?

What I was meaning is that since you mention the `ZookeeperClient` from BK, that wrapper is already collecting the latency stats (through the `StatsLogger` mechanism). Isn't that enough to collect and report the latencies?

> What I was meaning is that since you mention the ZookeeperClient from BK, that wrapper is already collecting the latency stats (through the StatsLogger mechanism). 

[OpStatsLogger](https://github.com/apache/bookkeeper/blob/master/bookkeeper-server/src/main/java/org/apache/bookkeeper/zookeeper/ZooWorker.java#L45) is not present into [BK-Yahoo version](https://github.com/yahoo/bookkeeper/blob/yahoo-4.3/bookkeeper-server/src/main/java/org/apache/bookkeeper/zookeeper/ZooWorker.java)
@jai1 the test did pass this time but it seems there's some race condition with this change that triggers to access the shared_prt after it was destroyed.

I know, that's why I was saying whether it was easier to just import the
code, until we sync up with future BK releases :)

--
Matteo Merli
<matteo.merli@gmail.com>

This commit is trying to do more than just making broker configurable to own non persistent topics. Or is it due to PR #452 is not merged yet?

> This commit is trying to do more than just making broker configurable to own non persistent topics. Or is it due to PR #452 is not merged yet?

Yes, it has two commits but you can review this PR specific [commits](https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/pull/538/commits) at [db8e757c7](https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/pull/538/commits/db8e757c7aa809691baee8b1fd026cd136f26584)
Not sure, if this will force bookkeeper to fetch this specific version until if we define this version into bk-pom dependency..

> Not sure, if this will force bookkeeper to fetch this specific version until if we define this version into bk-pom dependency..

I have verified that the version we're pulling in the bin.tgz package is the 4.2.0

> client-lib uses singleton proto-BaseCommand to get send (cmd.mutable_send()) cmd. If application uses batch and non-batch producers then batch-producer sets num_message into the command and same command used by non-batch producer which picks up this stale invalid value and sends invalid num_batch_msg to broker for monitoring.

I don't understand clearly how this relates with topic lookup requests, which it seems to be changed in the PR.
@rdhabalia  I think I merged too early. The tests are failing after this change

> I don't understand clearly how this relates with topic lookup requests, which it seems to be changed in the PR.

`cmd.mutable_CMD` always returns the same object reference which will not be thread-safe if multiple thread calls on same `BaseCommand cmd`. as you can see in previous comment updating `num_message` doesn't get reset/destroy for subsequent call. Now, [lookup call doesn't take lock before using BaseCommand.mutable_lookuptopic](https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/blob/master/pulsar-client-cpp/lib/ClientConnection.cc?utf8=%E2%9C%93#L941), therefore, concurrent lookup thread can update the value of this reference which is not thread-safe. 

now, we might not want to take lock on lookup for performance so, I added new BaseCommand creation while serializing lookup-command.

> cmd.mutable_CMD always returns the same object reference which will not be thread-safe if multiple thread calls on same BaseCommand cmd. as you can see in previous comment updating num_message doesn't get reset/destroy for subsequent call. Now, lookup call doesn't take lock before using BaseCommand.mutable_lookuptopic, therefore, concurrent lookup thread can update the value of this reference which is not thread-safe.

One other option would be to have a static instance of the BaseCommand for the lookup purposes, and always use the same instance, protected by a mutex.
@rdhabalia I think we need the mutex also at ClientConnection.cc:937

> I think we need the mutex also at ClientConnection.cc:937

Yes missed it. I thought i had taken care of it before.
Any additional thoughts or concerns about this PR? I'd like to get the first cut out, so that can enable the website, and later we can continue iterate on the content.
should we add license to site/_sass/*scss files?

> should we add license to site/_sass/*scss files?

I'm not sure that's 100% required, since they're not going to be included in the src or binary distribution, just exposed as website.

> README.md logo still points to docs/img/pulsar.png which is moved under site

Good point, this should be fixed. 
Also, after this commit, we should fix the README to include basic instructions on how to compile from sources.

Ok, jersey aws expecting an `int` and faild with `long` apparently, I now cast it to int, failing if it overflows

in all the tests, it seems blocked on the line : 

```java
PulsarClientImpl testClient = (PulsarClientImpl) service.getPulsarClient();
```

yes, recently all the builds are failing on this test case. 

>in all the tests, it seems blocked on the line :

yes, thread is stuck while creating `PulsarClientImpl` but don't see a clear reason, looking into it.
`WebSocketService.java:169`

[WebSocketService](https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/blob/master/pulsar-websocket/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/websocket/WebSocketService.java#L85) creates `localCluster` on service init so, in this test-case, it should not be null.

Tested pushing from my repo to personal docker hub account: 

https://hub.docker.com/u/merlimat/ 

https://travis-ci.org/merlimat/pulsar/builds/254662796

it seems it's a deadlock while loading runtime library.
`Epoll.isAvailable()` tries to load library and that thread is in RUNNABLE state which is holding a lock required by other thread.

@merlimat Moved explanations for wildcard matching to permissions.md.

If @msb-at-yahoo says it works, I 100% trust him.

A couple of questions : 
 1. Why not C++14 ? 
 2. Which minimum GCC version do you plan to target?
@saandrews @rdhabalia Ping
Yes, I've been busy, I made this change mostly because brokers use PulsarAdmin internally, and found that sometimes requests hang for a very long time.

Since nobody else is waiting on this change I would like to take divide the work into three parts and deploy each part to production before making the next change:-
a. Upgrade to C++11 and clean up the code
b. Upgrade the compiler (version not decided)
c. Upgrade to C++14 

So in a span of six weeks (two pulsar releases), the entire thing should complete.

Yes, I would suggest to replace all the usages of `boost` features with the correspondent c++11. 

Also, if you find it useful, you can create a "Project" in Github to track all the various tasks in tickets.
Ok, this won't work until we also enabled the `reuseForks=false`. Closing for now

Yeah, lets move forward with c++11 first. We should replace the usage as
well as long as they are compatible.
